review: "How bad could it be for $35?" I asked myself before ordering the Chromecast. The answer: pretty much worthless. I live in a small house (less than 900 square feet). The wireless router is 22 feet from the TV. The Samsung laptop is 8 feet from the TV. Yet the Chromecast regularly loses contact with the signal. After dozens of tries, I'm simply not able to stream in its entirety an hour-length TV show from sites such as ABC.com or CBS.com. Similarly, I've never been able to view an entire Netflix movie without losing the connection. When the connection is there, the video is either extremely pixelated, or the video is jump, with multi-second pauses between screen refreshes.
